Posts.Content: Well Mooninsmum, you have truly inspired me to give it another bash if u suffered and persevered I too can do this. You're prob right that in another 3 weeks I will be ready to try it again.  Thanks  Amanda X
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Aww thanks Ann for thinking of me. Today i feel fine. Breast care nurse has rang me and said a lot of her patients report sickness on the eve of chemo and then ok after so fingers crossed that's me. I didn't sleep last night but I've got backups - Netflix etc for that.    My appetite isn't great. Just eating fruit at the mo and toast. Re your serious munchies which made me chuckle I think it's prob just your body mending itself. I was like that about a week after surgery.  Keep me updated too Amanda X
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: I started my first lot of FEC yesterday And gave the Paxman cold cap a try. I felt sick within about half hour and this continued for most of it. it was unbearable. I could take the pain but not this sickness. Has anyone else experienced this and any tips?
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi Ann,  Yes I was I had anti sickness via canula. As Iona said it was prob a mixture of nerves and not eating properly. I was really sick when I got home too but it seems to have subsided today fingers crossed. I really don't want to lose hair but I'm not sure if I can face that again. How are you finding chemo?  Amanda
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Well Mooninsmum, you have truly inspired me to give it another bash if u suffered and persevered I too can do this. You're prob right that in another 3 weeks I will be ready to try it again.  Thanks  Amanda X
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi Iona,  I did mention it to them and they said they hadn't known anyone else to feel Sick with the cap. I felt sick before the actual chemo drugs were going in so it must have been that. I hadn't eaten very much before so I think next time I will eat more, take co codamol and have  an anti sickness tab. How are you getting on with cap? Have you kept hair?  Amanda
Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi Ann,  Yes I was I had anti sickness via canula. As Iona said it was prob a mixture of nerves and not eating properly. I was really sick when I got home too but it seems to have subsided today fingers crossed. I really don't want to lose hair but I'm not sure if I can face that again. How are you finding chemo?  Amanda

Posts.Content: Aww thanks Ann for thinking of me. Today i feel fine. Breast care nurse has rang me and said a lot of her patients report sickness on the eve of chemo and then ok after so fingers crossed that's me. I didn't sleep last night but I've got backups - Netflix etc for that.    My appetite isn't great. Just eating fruit at the mo and toast. Posts.Title: Sickness with cold cap

Posts.Content: That is brilliant!! A RIP boobbbq party!! Haha.  My recovery was absolutely fine. They have you up and moving the day after. They sent me home from hosp with just paracetamol and I felt in pain so was prescribed cocodamol. Don't let them fob you off with paracetamol and take the meds as they helped massively.  My sister bought me a mini fan for hospital and I was so greatful for it!  Amanda
Posts.Title: diagnosed 2 days ago and having double mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a mastectomy back in February. The biggest tip I can give you is to get really comfortable pillows that will allow you to sleep upright as I couldn't lie flat for a while. I then got a pillow that goes around your neck to support it while asleep. It took me about a week to figure this out and wished someone would have told me.  Sorry to hear that you have to go through this. If you have any questions I'd be happy to answer any.  Take care  Amanda xx
Posts.Title: diagnosed 2 days ago and having double mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks very much for all your replies. I am definately going to give it a go. My first chemo is on Tuesday and I'm so scared.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: My hair is certainly my pride and joy and that's why I feel this is going to be the most difficult. Can I ask why you thought it would be messing with the chemos journey?
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Wow ChrissieC, 70% of hair is amazing! If I can do that I will get through this enormous fight. Already lost my breast but can hide that. My hair is a diff story as you can most certainly understand .  Thanks xx
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Smile2016, who were you advised not to try from?  If there's a slight chance I can keep my hair I'm grabbing it. Good luck on Thursday xx
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: I'm starting my first chemo session on 5th April. Is it worth trying the cold cap?  Can anyone give me any advice good or bad please. The only info I have is from my breast care nurse.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi Ann, Thanks very much for your advice. Is it as painful as people say?
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Smile2016, did they give you reasons why? My oncologist and breast care nurse were all for it.
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Thankyou for your reply. They gave me a choice of chemo or surgery and I picked surgery as I was absolutely terrified and thought I need to get this out of the way! Never had any surgery before this. Honestly, it's fine. I have to have a further op to remove expander and put in implant and they are also going to give my other breast a lift abx reduction and I'm actually looking forward to that! My friends and family can't believe it as I was truly terrified! The surgery is nothing that a bit of pain relief and relaxing on your sofa won't sort. I was out of hospital in 2 days and the nurses were amazing. Are you having immediate reconstruction?  Thanks for advice on chemo. I'm just having one of those days and need to put my big girl pants on! Xx
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Thankyou xx That's exactly why I came here because of an off day and hope that I can draw strength from here when I need it. It's not something you can just say no thanks I'll give it a miss is it and that's the scary part. In fact today I told my sister I'm not doing it to which she replied oh you are, even if I have to drag you by your hair and when you have no hair I'll drag you by your ankle. My other sister then text saying - and I'll have your other ankle! No getting out of it then and it did make me chuckle! Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Brilliant piece of advice! At the end of the day we could be facing much worse.  It's the fear of the Unknown but once I get into the swing of it I know I'll be able to do it with lots of support. I feel really lucky to have my family and friends around me it's just some days I just get into a down period which isn't me!  Glad I found this place, no one really fully understands unless you are going through it.  Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Thanks for your kind words. I feel a lot better after coming here tonight and getting some positive advice and truthful words from people who are in the know.  They wanted to start me on chemo next week but after only 3 weeks post surgery I didn't think my mind or body was ready. Starting 5th April and going to try and go away for a few days before that. Need a bit of normality.  Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: I really hope that you don't have to have Chemotherapy and you just have radio and hormone❤️ Best of luck to you too xx
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Diagnosed with breast cancer in Jan. Had mastectomy with tissue expander in Feb. After about a million meetings I finally met my Oncologist yesterday and I feel so overwhelmed by the treatment coming and scared. I'm having 6 cycles. 1st 3 FEC and 2nd Docetaxel. Radio for 3 weeks and then hormone treatment for 5 years. I've been quite positive up to now but this has really knocked me for 6!
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed!

Posts.Content: Hi Pam, They will let you keep your own underwear on but trust me those nickers  will stretch to fit any size and weirdly I found them comfy instead of my own! You always see a nurse before you go on for op and at this point just tell her you want to wear your own underwear. I too was worried about these nickers everyone warns you about but there's really no need to be. The staff are so kind and gentle and are ready for any anxieties.  Hope everything goes ok Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Having a meltdown
